aboutP1: CodeLife is the product of the Code School Brazil Project of the State Funding Agency of Minas Gerais - FAPEMIG. A free online resource for high school students in Brazil to learn skills relevant to work in Brazil’s IT sector. The platform’s seed content will focus on teaching basic Javascript.
aboutP2: CodeLife aims to be a free web platform where students can learn a variety skills useful for work in Brazil’s IT sector (ex. frontend development, UI design, data visualization). Users of CSB will be able to learn independently from physical classrooms, in order to provide a resource for students who may not otherwise have adequate learning opportunities.
aboutP3: The primary target audience of the platform MVP are students aged 14-18 in Brazilian public school. Testing will initially focus on students in Greater Belo Horizonte. At minimum all content will be created natively in Portuguese and English and the curriculum will be designed to complement the public education in Brazil
aboutP4: The platform’s seed curriculum will cover dynamic web development and integrate Brazilian data using the DataViva API.
aboutP5: In addition to working with students, school administration, teachers and government officials, the platform’s features will be designed with Brazilian businesses to connect students with potential employers.

CSS.def: CSS is a computer language that can change the style of a web page.

alert.def: A javascript method that makes a popup.

backgroundColor.def: A CSS property that changes the color of an element’s background.

backgroundImage.def: A CSS property that adds a background image to a webpage.

body.def: Content inside the <body> tag is displayed directly on the webpage.

closingtag.def: This tag indicates the end of an HTML element. It has a slash before its name.

code.def: Code is a set of written instructions that tells a computer what to do. Examples of coding languages: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

codeeditor.def: The code editor is where you will edit your code to make your webpages.

color.def: A CSS property that changes the color of text and content.

css.def: CSS is a computer language that can change the style of a web page.

h1.def: This tag is used to indicate that the content will be a large title.

html.def: HTML creates the content and structure of a webpage, and it's one of the main languages for building websites
html.exampleTxt1: The rest of your web page goes in here!

htmltag.def: Content inside the <html> tag is HTML code

javascript.def: JavaScript is one of the languages for creating webpages. It creates the interactive components of a website. Examples can be slideshows, animations, etc.

letterSpacing.def: A CSS property that changes the distance between letters in text.

method.def: In JavaScript, we use methods to perform tasks and actions in the code we are writing.

openingtag.def: This tag indicates the beginning of an HTML element.

p.def: This tag is used to indicate that the content will be a paragraph.This tag is used to indicate that the content will be a paragraph.

property.def: A CSS term. A property indicates what about your content you want to style.

script.def: A tag that indicates JavaScript is being written instead of HTML. It goes right before the closing <body> tag.
script.exampleTxt1: alert(“This is JavaScript inside a script tag!”);

selector.def: A CSS term. A selector indicates which content in your html file you want to style.

string.def: When you want to use text in JavaScript, wrap it in quotes to make it a string. This way, javascript can understand your text.

style.def: A tag that indicates CSS is being written instead of HTML. It goes inside the <head> tag.

tags.def: Tags are part of the HTML language.

textAlign.def: A CSS property that changes how text is aligned on the page. Its three most common values are left, center, and right.

titletag.def: Content inside the <title> tag is displayed on the top tab of a page, when you add a page to favorites, and for search-engine results.

value.def: A CSS term. A value indicates how you want to style your content.

home.prompt: Join the revolution, and start your adventure today!
home.tagline: CodeLife is a free online tool that teaches Brazilian teenagers information technology and web skills.

access.li1: See what data we have about you, if any.
access.li2: Change/correct any data we have about you.
access.li3: Have us delete any data we have about you.
access.li4: Express any concern you have about our use of your data.
access.p1: You may opt out of any future contacts from us at any time. You can do the following at any time by contacting us via the email address or phone number given on our website:
access.title: Your Access to and Control Over Information

cookies.p1: We use "cookies" on this site. A cookie is a piece of data stored on a site visitor's hard drive to help us improve your access to our site and identify repeat visitors to our site. For instance, when we use a cookie to identify you, you would not have to log in a password more than once, thereby saving time while on our site. Cookies can also enable us to track and target the interests of our users to enhance the experience on our site. Usage of a cookie is in no way linked to any personally identifiable information on our site.
cookies.title: Cookies

footer.p1: If you feel that we are not abiding by this privacy policy, you should contact us immediately.

info.p1: We are the sole owners of the information collected on this site. We only have access to/collect information that you voluntarily give us via email or other direct contact from you. We will not sell or rent this information to anyone.
info.p2: We will use your information to respond to you, regarding the reason you contacted us. We will not share your information with any third party outside of our organization.
info.p3: Unless you ask us not to, we may contact you via email in the future to tell you about special events, new features or services, or changes to this privacy policy.
info.title: Information Collection, Use, and Sharing

links.p1: This website contains links to other sites. Please be aware that we are not responsible for the content or privacy practices of such other sites. We encourage our users to be aware when they leave our site and to read the privacy statements of any other site that collects personally identifiable information.
links.title: Links

notice.li1: What personally identifiable information is collected from you through the website, how it is used and with whom it may be shared.
notice.li2: What choices are available to you regarding the use of your data.
notice.li3: The security procedures in place to protect the misuse of your information.
notice.li4: How you can correct any inaccuracies in the information.
notice.p1: This privacy notice discloses the privacy practices for www.codelife.com. This privacy notice applies solely to information collected by this website. It will notify you of the following:

registration.p1: In order to use this website, a user must first complete the registration form. During registration a user is required to give certain information (such as name and contact information). This information is used to contact you about the features on our site in which you have expressed interest. At your option, you may also provide demographic information (such as gender or age) about yourself, but it is not required.
registration.title: Registration

security.p1: We take precautions to protect your information. When you submit sensitive information via the website, your information is protected both online and offline.
security.p2: Wherever we collect sensitive information, that information is encrypted and transmitted to us in a secure way. You can verify this by looking for a lock icon in the address bar and looking for "https" at the beginning of the address of the Web page.
security.p3: While we use encryption to protect sensitive information transmitted online, we also protect your information offline. Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job (for example, customer service) are granted access to personally identifiable information. The computers/servers in which we store personally identifiable information are kept in a secure environment.
security.title: Security

saveWarning: Save your changes before opening a new webpage.

splashP1: CodeLife is a website for teenagers in Brazil to learn information technology and web skills for free.
splashP2: The platform is currently under development but early users will be invited to preview the site in summer 2017. Testing will begin with users in Greater Belo Horizonte but users in other regions eager to help us build CodeLife are encouraged to get in touch.
splashP3: The platform’s seed curriculum will cover dynamic web development and data visualization using the DataViva API.
splashP4: Interested in learning more? Sign up or shoot us an email.
